Reason: The 'network_authorizer' configuration is performance-sensitive. This is because the 'networkAuthCache' initialization in the 'AuthenticatedUser' class involves fetching the 'NetworkAuthorizer' from 'DatabaseDescriptor' which can have time-expensive and memory-expensive operations. Additionally, the 'hasLocalAccess()' method in the 'AuthenticatedUser' class directly accesses the 'networkAuthCache' to check for local access permissions, which can lead to notable performance variations at the system level.
